title: Chef José Andrés bashes Trump at food and wine festival
text:
Chef José Andrés — who is embroiled in a lawsuit with President Trump after pulling out of a deal to open a restaurant in Trump’s Washington, DC, hotel — gave a speech criticizing POTUS’ immigration policy at a fancy Miami food event.

Then he “tore off his chef’s jacket to reveal a T-shirt with ‘I am an immigrant’ written across it.”

We’re told that at a party during the South Beach Wine & Food Festival, where Andrés was honored, he said, “We do need to be building walls — to build communities, to build schools, to build hospitals, to build community centers, soup kitchens.”

At a later dinner at SLS South Beach, guests included Gloria Estefan, Anthony Bourdain and Andrew Zimmern.
summary:
Chef José Andrés — who is embroiled in a lawsuit with President Trump after pulling out of a deal to open a restaurant in Trump’s Washington, DC, hotel — gave a speech criticizing POTUS’ immigration policy at a fancy Miami food event.
Then he “tore off his chef’s jacket to reveal a T-shirt with ‘I am an immigrant’ written across it.”We’re told that at a party during the South Beach Wine & Food Festival, where Andrés was honored, he said, “We do need to be building walls — to build communities, to build schools, to build hospitals, to build community centers, soup kitchens.”At a later dinner at SLS South Beach, guests included Gloria Estefan, Anthony Bourdain and Andrew Zimmern.
